chapter.title: The Distribution Plugin

note.para: The distribution plugin is currently incubating. Please be aware that the DSL and other configuration may change in later Gradle versions.

chapter.para: The distribution plugin facilitates building archives that serve as distributions of the project. Distribution archives typically contain then executable application and other supporting files, such as documentation.

section.title: Usage
section.para: To use the distribution plugin, include in your build script:

The plugin adds an extension named "distributions" of type to the project. It also creates a single distribution in the distributions container extension named "main". If your build only produces one distribution you only need to configure this distribution (or use the defaults).

You can run "gradle distZip" to package the main distribution as a ZIP, or "gradle distTar" to create a GZip compressed TAR file. The files will be created at "$buildDir/distributions/$project.name-$project.version.«ext»".
You can run "gradle installDist" to assembles the distribution content, uncompressed, into "$buildDir/install/main".

section.title: Tasks
section.para: The Distribution plugin adds the following tasks to the project:

tr.td: Creates a ZIP archive of the distribution contents
Creates a ZIP archive of the distribution contents
Assembles the distribution content and installs it on the current machine

section.para: For each extra distribution set you add to the project, the distribution plugin adds the following tasks:

tr.td: Creates a ZIP archive of the distribution contents
Creates a TAR archive of the distribution contents
Assembles the distribution content and installs it on the current machine

section.para:
This will add following tasks to the project:
customDistZip customDistTar installCustomDist
Given that the project name is "myproject" and version "1.2", running "gradle customDistZip" will produce a ZIP file named "myproject-custom-1.2.zip".
Running "gradle installCustomDist" will install the distribution contents into "$buildDir/install/custom".

section.title: Distribution contents
section.para: All of the files in the "src/$distribution.name/dist" directory will automatically be included in the distribution. You can add additional files by configuring the object that is part of the container.
In the above example, the content of the "src/readme" directory will be included in the distribution (along with the files in the "src/dist/main" directory which are added by default).
The "baseName" property has also been changed. This will cause the distribution archives to be created with a different name.
